g.title: Rectangle
g.desc: Abstract Factory (=Kit) Creates families of related or depend...
g.text: Abstract Factory (=Kit)Creates families of related or dependent objects using abstractions

g.title: Rectangle.3
g.desc: Objects are constrained to be used as a ‘group’
g.text: Objects are constrained to be used as a ‘group’

g.title: Folded Corner
g.desc: The system should be capable to switch between different beha...

g.text: The system should be capable to switch between different behaviors or layouts. A behavior or layout ‘set’ is realized by a set of objects. The set of objects need to cooperate to fulfill the functionality, otherwise an odd layout or strange behavior might exist. This design intent is clarified and constrained using the Abstract Factory pattern.

g.title: Rectangle.9
g.desc: The system must switch between different layouts or behaviors...
g.text: The system must switch between different layouts or behaviors ‘sets’

g.title: Folded Corner.15
g.desc: The responsibility of creating a sub - system will reside in ...

g.text: The responsibility of creating a sub - system will reside in the Abstract Factory. The Abstract Factory knows the details of the concrete types and what is required to create them. The single point of access supports the Open Closed principle, because we can easily introduce new factories and products and swap implementations.

g.title: Folded Corner.20
g.desc: The Abstract Factory pattern makes extensively use of interfa...

g.text: The Abstract Factory pattern makes extensively use of interfaces. This will make it easy to introduce new factories and products, because our client code is not bounded to the concrete type (= Dependency inversion). The system can be extended without modifying it.

g.title: Folded Corner.41
g.desc: The Abstract factory pattern makes it possible to change the ...

g.text: The Abstract factory pattern makes it possible to change the layout or behavior of a (sub-) system from a single point. We can instantiate our system with different object families by simply changing our factory. This reduces maintenance, because we don’t have to modify and track all the related objects scattered over our code base.

g.title: Rectangle.47
g.desc: Clients need runtime variation in the ‘products’ they use
g.text: Clients need runtime variation in the ‘products’ they use

g.title: Rectangle.46
g.desc: The construction logic is likely to change
g.text: The construction logic is likely to change

g.title: Folded Corner.47
g.desc: See: ‘Simple Factory VS Factory Method VS Abstract Factory’

g.text: See: ‘Simple Factory VS Factory Method VS Abstract Factory’

g.title: Folded Corner.57
g.desc: See: ‘Simple Factory VS Factory Method VS Abstract Factory’

g.text: See: ‘Simple Factory VS Factory Method VS Abstract Factory’
